mdRecord.dcterms:title: Thomas Coleman Andrews, Jr., national chairman of George C. Wallace's American Independent Party, introduces the presidential candidate at the Hotel Roanoke in Roanoke, Va.; Wallace challenges Richard M. Nixon and Hubert H. Humphrey to a televised debate
mdRecord.dcterms:description: At the Hotel Roanoke in Roanoke, Va., Thomas Coleman Andrews, Jr., national chairman of the American Independent Party, introduces the party's presidential candidate George C. Wallace. Wallace challenges opponents Richard M. Nixon and Hubert H. Humphrey to a televised debate, saying he would "fix both of them up." Footage switches to Wallace walking on an airfield at Woodrum Field Airport in Roanoke, Va., and then back to the Hotel Roanoke press conference.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Presidents--United States--Election--1968
